AbstractText.sentence: Hydroxyurea (HU) is an antitumor agent which also induces hemoglobinization during erythroid differentiation.

event.clue: Hydroxyurea (HU) is an antitumor agent which also induces hemoglobinization during erythroid differentiation.
Hydroxyurea (HU) is an antitumor agent which also induces hemoglobinization during erythroid differentiation.

AbstractText.sentence: In addition, HU stimulates the synthesis of fetal hemoglobin in sickle cell anemia patients.

event.clue: In addition, HU stimulates the synthesis of fetal hemoglobin in sickle cell anemia patients.

AbstractText.sentence: To further understand its mechanism of action, we investigated the effects of HU on regulation of c-jun expression prior to the onset of erythroid differentiation of K562 cells.

AbstractText.sentence: HU induced a dose-dependent stimulation of c-jun synthesis.

event.clue: HU induced a dose-dependent stimulation of c-jun synthesis.

AbstractText.sentence: The levels of c-jun mRNA was elevated 4 to 7.5-fold by HU within 2 h.

event.clue: The levels of c-jun mRNA was elevated 4 to 7.5-fold by HU within 2 h.

AbstractText.sentence: This was followed by a gradual decline to the basal level by 24 h.

AbstractText.sentence: Both nuclear run-on and actinomycin D pulse experiments strongly indicate that HU regulates c-jun mRNA expression by increasing the rate of synthesis as well as stabilizing the c-jun mRNA.

AbstractText.sentence: In addition, the level of jun protein was elevated by 2 to 5-fold within 4 h in HU treated cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, concentrations of HU below 250 microM slightly increased the 5X AP-1/CAT activity.

AbstractText.sentence: These results strongly suggest that HU induces both transcriptional and post-transcription regulation of c-jun during erythroid differentiation.
